item.title: Executive Action Modifying Tariff Duties in Response to Threats Posed by the Government of the Russian Federation
item.description: Under constitutional and statutory authorities including the International Emergency Economic Powers Act, the National Emergencies Act, and Section 604 of the Trade Act of 1974, the President modifies import duties on goods from the Russian Federation to address threats to the United States posed by actions of the Russian government. This action, issued in February 2026, is part of the use of trade and economic powers to respond to national security concerns related to foreign governments. Disclaimer: This content is AI generated. Use at your own risk. Please consult the original articles for accurate information.

item.title: Executive Order Establishing a United States Arms Transfer Strategy Emphasizing Domestic Manufacturing
item.description: This executive order establishes a U.S. arms transfer strategy and directs relevant federal agencies to develop and implement policies governing the transfer and export of American-made military equipment. It emphasizes leveraging domestic manufacturing capabilities as a core element of defense export policy and seeks to coordinate actions across agencies to align arms transfers with national security, foreign policy, and economic objectives. The order outlines responsibilities for assessing markets, streamlining licensing processes where appropriate, and ensuring that arms transfers support U.S. strategic interests while maintaining transparency and oversight. Disclaimer: This content is AI generated. Use at your own risk. Please consult the original articles for accurate information.

item.title: Executive Order to Protect National Security and Welfare of the United States and Its Citizens from Criminal Actors and Other Public Safety Threats
item.description: This executive order asserts the President's authority under the Constitution and 6 U.S.C. 122(a)(2) to safeguard the welfare and security of the United States and its citizens from criminal actors and other public safety threats. It states the policy to protect national security and civil welfare, and directs federal agencies to coordinate activities to identify, deter, prevent, and respond to such threats, utilizing existing authorities and resources. The order calls for interagency collaboration, risk assessment, information sharing, and the implementation of protective measures in a manner consistent with applicable law, with responsibilities distributed across relevant departments and agencies to enhance national safety. Disclaimer: This content is AI generated. Use at your own risk. Please consult the original articles for accurate information.

item.title: Modifying Tariff Duties on Imports from the Government of the Russian Federation
item.description: Under the authority vested in the President by the Constitution and the laws of the United States, including the International Emergency Economic Powers Act, the National Emergencies Act, and provisions of the Trade Act of 1974 (including section 604) and section 301, the President modifies the duties applicable to goods imported from the Government of the Russian Federation. The action is intended to address threats to the United States presented by the Government of the Russian Federation and is implemented by amending the relevant tariff schedules in effect under these authorities. Disclaimer: This content is AI generated. Use at your own risk. Please consult the original articles for accurate information.

item.title: Proclamation Under the Antiquities Act Designating the Northeast Canyons and Seamounts Marine National Monument
item.description: On September 15, 2016, President Barack Obama issued Proclamation 9496, pursuant to the Antiquities Act (54 U.S.C. 320301), designating approximately 4,913 square miles of waters and submerged lands where the Atlantic Ocean meets the continental shelf as the Northeast Canyons and Seamounts Marine National Monument. The designation establishes a protected marine area within these boundaries and specifies that management and restrictions apply to activities within the monument to conserve its unique underwater canyons and seamounts. Disclaimer: This content is AI generated. Use at your own risk. Please consult the original articles for accurate information.

item.title: Proclamation on Ensuring the Availability and Affordability of Beef for American Consumers
item.description: A presidential proclamation recognizing the historical role of cattle ranchers in the United States and the continued importance of beef in the American diet. The document outlines the goal of maintaining the availability of beef and ensuring its affordability for American consumers, and discusses considerations related to the beef supply chain and market conditions. Disclaimer: This content is AI generated. Use at your own risk. Please consult the original articles for accurate information.

item.title: Nomination of Michael McDonald to be Chairperson of the National Endowment for the Humanities for a four-year term
item.description: The White House announced the nomination of Michael McDonald, a resident of the District of Columbia, to serve as Chairperson of the National Endowment for the Humanities for a four-year term, succeeding Shelly C. Lowe. The nomination has been transmitted to the Senate for its consideration. Disclaimer: This content is AI generated. Use at your own risk. Please consult the original articles for accurate information.

item.title: Executive Action Addressing Threats Posed by the Government of Cuba Under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act and the National Emergencies Act
item.description: This presidential action asserts authority under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act and the National Emergencies Act to address threats attributed to the Government of Cuba. It states the determination and orders the measures described in Section 1, with the substantive provisions not reproduced in this excerpt. The action directs relevant federal agencies to implement and enforce the authorities and restrictions authorized in the document and to coordinate the execution of these measures.
